intro: Bowkeria calceolarioides, commonly known as the African violet. This plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The leaves are typically velvety and dark green, often with a waxy texture. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
